snippet: In passing the Affordable Care Act, Congress expanded a program requiring price limits on certain medications sold at clinics in low-income areas.
abstract: Judge Rudolph Contreras of the Federal District Court in Washington, DC, strikes down rule under Affordable Care Act that requires drug companies to offer certain drugs at discounted prices; decision could provide windfall for pharmaceutical companies.
lead_paragraph: In passing the Affordable Care Act, Congress expanded a program requiring price limits on certain medications sold at clinics in low-income areas.

headline.main: Judge Voids Expansion of Discount Drug Program
headline.print_headline: Judge Voids Expansion of Discount Drug Program

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
